intro: Pulsatilla grandis f. borbasiana, commonly known as the Borbasian pasqueflower, is a rare and distinctive variant of the pasqueflower. It is a herbaceous perennial belonging to the Ranunculaceae family, characterized by its showy, showy, cup-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, preferring well-drained, rocky soils. Its foliage consists of basal leaves that are deeply lobed and hairy, and it is known for its ornamental value in gardens. This form is distinguished by its larger flower size and unique coloration compared to the typical species.
